meanings.definition: Widespread in a particular area or at a particular time.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, squirrels are prevalent, meaning you see them everywhere.
meanings.sent2: During the summer, mosquitoes are prevalent in the swampy areas.
meanings.sent3: The prevalent squirrels in the park seem to have a secret meeting every morning.
meanings.sent4: The prevalent smell of fresh bread in the bakery entices customers from afar.
meanings.sent5: The prevalent sound of chirping birds fills the air with life and energy.

meanings.sent1: Headaches are prevalent after a long day of staring at screens.
meanings.sent2: In the city, traffic jams are prevalent during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The prevalent idea of a cat driving a car is both amusing and absurd.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as prevalent as the sunshine on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The prevalent use of smartphones has changed the way we communicate.
